posts.post_content:
Level abilities are triggered by the level so Necrotic Ooze can't get them (although it can put level counters on itself, they're useless).  
  
Focused on Standard lets see what's available. Most this is too slow or takes too many cards to be competitive...  
  
[Fauna Shaman](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fauna Shaman) is a perfect fit. Not only can it help get the critters we want to graveyard, but the Ooze can learn her ability.  
  
[Gigantomancer](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gigantomancer) and [Spikeshot Elder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spikeshot Elder) should end the game pretty quickly at 7 damage for 2RR then attack.  
[Spawnsire of Ulamog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Spawnsire of Ulamog) gives 2 tokens for 4 that can be sacced for 1. With a Training Ground, that gets interesting quickly. At the very least, you can build up mana and use them as immediately replaced (using the mana from saccing them) chump blockers.  
  
[Sphinx of the Magosi](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sphinx of the Magosi) for counters and draw...for U with [Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds).  
[Carnifex Demon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Carnifex Demon) if we can figure out ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

Posted By: ratchet1215 (11/15/2010 4:54:22 PM)

posts.post_content:
From the comprehensive rules PDF.  
  
*201.4b If an ability of an object refers to that object by name, and an object with a different name  
gains that ability, all instances of the first name in the gained ability should be treated as the  
second name.*  
  
So if you have a myr propagator in the graveyard and a necrotic ooze in play, the ability gained by the ooze should for all intents and purposes read,   
  
3, Tap: Put a token that's a copy of *necrotic ooze* onto the battlefield.  
  
So... Many.... Combos.... .!. (head explodes).
posts.html:
From the comprehensive rules PDF.

201.4b If an ability of an object refers to that object by name, and an object with a different name
gains that ability, all instances of the first name in the gained ability should be treated as the
second name.

So if you have a myr propagator in the graveyard and a necrotic ooze in play, the ability gained by the ooze should for all intents and purposes read,

3, Tap: Put a token that's a copy of necrotic ooze onto the battlefield.

So... Many.... Combos.... .!. (head explodes).

Posted By: roguepariah (10/1/2010 3:24:28 AM)
Rating:

@abmaynar

Reassembling Skeleton 's ability can only be activated while it's in the graveyard. Necrotic Ooze's static ability only works on the battlefield. At no point could Necrotic Ooze have the ability and activate it, too.

Even if you could activate it from the battlefield, rule 400.7 states that the Necrotic Ooze whose ability you activated on the battlefield is not the same Necrotic Ooze that appears in the graveyard, even if it's the same card. The ability would resolve, search for the Necrotic Ooze that was on the battlefield, and do nothing since that Necrotic Ooze has ceased to exist.

@RentNalo-MasterTS
Landfall abilities are almost always triggered abilities. Necrotic Ooze does not gain them.

posts.post_content:
@ ThePhoenixOfDoom: What are you talking about? [Necrotic Ooze](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrotic Ooze) doesn't interact with [Viridian Emissary](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Viridian Emissary) in any way; it has triggered ability, NOT activated. For the 100th time: Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "Cost: Effect."  
  
@ SyntheticDreamer: It would be much more efficient to just use the [Griselbrand](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Griselbrand) itself, since with flying+lifelink you get your life back = free 7 cards. Not so with Ooze.

posts.post_content:
Abilities with the ![Untap](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=untap&type=symbol) symbol is particularly exploitable. For any combo requiring cheap untapping, [Puresight Merrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Puresight Merrow) and [Leech Bonder](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leech Bonder) are both better than [Horseshoe Crab](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Horseshoe Crab).  
  
[Palladium Myr](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Palladium Myr) + [Pili-Pala](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pili-Pala) = Infinite mana of any color  
  
Any creature that can tap for ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) + [Knacksaw Clique](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Knacksaw Clique) + [Training Grounds](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Training Grounds) or [Heartstone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Heartstone) = Infinite milling  
  
Any creature that can tap for ![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) or ![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) + [Puresight Merrow](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Puresight Merrow) + [Laboratory Maniac](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Laboratory Maniac) (in play) = Win through self-milling
posts.html:
Abilities with the symbol is particularly exploitable. For any combo requiring cheap untapping, Puresight Merrow and Leech Bonder are both better than Horseshoe Crab.

Palladium Myr + Pili-Pala = Infinite mana of any color

Any creature that can tap for + Knacksaw Clique + Training Grounds or Heartstone = Infinite milling

Any creature that can tap for or + Puresight Merrow + Laboratory Maniac (in play) = Win through self-milling
